task.title: Using XPath Extension Function
task.shortdesc: This topic explains how to use the XPath Extension Function API to implement XPath functions and register them with the XML DOM Engine.

li.p: understand XPath syntax and the concept of Document Object Model (DOM).
understand the architecture and classes of the XML DOM Engine component.

context.p: XPath is a query language for exploring XML documents. You can extend it with domain-specific functions or with general utility functions, to add functionality to XPath queries.

step.cmd: Write a new class that implements the MXmlEngXPathEvaluationContext interface.
step.info: This class represents the evaluation context. It processes the arguments of the extension function and stores the result of the evaluation.

step.cmd: Write a new class that implements the MXPathExtensionFunction interface.
step.info: This class represents the new extension function. The MXPathExtensionFunction::Evaluate() function uses its MXmlEngXPathEvaluationContext parameter to process input arguments and return a result. This result can be a set of nodes, a number, a boolean or a string.

step.cmd: Create an instance of the new extension function class.

step.info: This structure contains a pointer to the new extension function, the name of the function, and the optional namespace URI.

step.cmd: Register this instance by calling the static TXmlEngXPathConfiguration::AddExtensionFunctionL() function.
Use the new extension function in an XPath query.
